div.p: Arquivo Histórico do Museu Bocage, Universidade de Lisboa, Lisbon.
MS annotation: 'Respond a 28 de julho 1878' [Replied 28 July 1878]. Letter not found. 15/3/78.

I have just despatched a Ceratodus to you, dear Dr du Bocage, by the "Excelsior", which ship leaves direct from Port Phillip
Port Phillip Bay, Vic. to Hamburg. The fish is adressed to Dr W. Sonder (the celebrated author of South African plants), who for many years has acted there as my honorary Agent. Please put yourself in communication with Dr Sonder (Adr. Neuer Wall), so that the best arrangements may be made to get the specimen safely across. All expenses as far as Hamburg are paid for the transit. I had great difficulty to procure this specimen, and this is a large one.
Simultaneously I have dispatched some dried plants to Dr Gomez, which might be forwarded simultaneously with the Ceratodus from Hamburg to Lisbon.
Trusting that this precious specimen will reach you safely, and that it will afford you an additional object for your learned researches I remain
